column4: Hi i have a problem with Ubuntu 6.10. When i boot up ubuntu it shows the ubuntu loading screen and then my monitor goes to standby
nope i tried restarting xorg but i get this drum noise and my monitor tuirns off
ubuntu used to work correctly for you, or did you just install it?
no i have not changed anything its a fresh install and i got all the updates
what is the command to reconfigure my xorg
do you have any ideas. everytime i update my xconf to the new nvidia drivers my monitor goes to standby. so i think the drivers are not compatible
I know that when I triple-booted my computer I had the same problem
no i am only using XP and ubuntu
I think that my computer did not like 64bit ubuntu at all
I think the principal still applies
how do i check if my ubuntu is 64 or 32
do you have your ubuntu install CD?
have you tried booting from that?
well i can just reconfigure my xserver and it fixes it
its just i am puzzled becos i am updating my nvidia drivers and they dont work so what else am i spose to do :(
I'm sorry, I'm a noob with linux, I just know that I was having a very similar problem and thought I might offer up my solution
